name: The Loralei B&B

reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!
reviews.text: Robert is a gracious and friendly host. The B&B is perfectly kept, and Robert was very helpful with tourism and dining suggestions. The neighborhood is quiet and safe, and very close to the subway... 20 minutes to Manhattan. We're sending our friends to Loralei, and hope to go back again someday. Thank you, Robert!

reviews.title: The Loralei B & B was great!!
reviews.text: My wife and I visited the Loralei over the Christmas Holiday 2005. We found the property to be very 'homey' and pleasant when away form our own home during the Holiday Season. Robert was an excellent and very helpful host. The B&B was very well maintained and extremely clean. As a highlight each morning, we enjoyed the breakfast. Robert served a very good variety of fresh fruits and baked goods, with new and different items each morning. When you live away from NYC, it is always a treat to get back for good bagels at breakfast and Robert served a fresh assortment each morning. We will certainly consider another visit to the Loralei on a future visit to the NYC area.

reviews.title: B&B with gracious host
reviews.text: My friend and I much enjoyed staying at the Loralei. Robert was an extremely gracious host, with whom we also enjoyed talking at length about all kinds of interesting things. Lovely big room (the Gramercy Suite), with a spacious bathroom. Breakfast was generous and always fresh. The only (very minor) downside was that we tended to be woken up fairly early in the morning because of creaking floors. But that comes with old houses -- we would recommend Loralei any time!

reviews.title: a great location
reviews.text: We loved the Loralei from the moment we set eyes on it. After a delayed transatlantic flight and a hectic journey from Newark Liberty Airport we were met at the door by our host Robert and immediately made welcome.
Our room, the Gramercy suite was not only spacious but was tastefully furnished with a well appointed bathroom. It was spotlessly clean as well.
reviews.title: Truly a home away from home

reviews.text: We stayed here for three days while visiting our son who lives in a small Brooklyn apartment. The Lorelei met our every need, from the air conditioned rooms, to the charming breakfast, the clean & pleasant bathroom, and relatively easy parking on the streets. We had the suite with the sitting room and that allowed for reading after one of us had gone to bed. Our host could not have been more delightful and we found that with two keys it was very easy to come and go at all hours. This was our first time driving in Brooklyn and we ended up using the car often to get to sights and meet up with our son. Parking is pretty straightforward if you read the signs and we certainly had no problems parking near the Lorelei. And the subway is nearby for when you want to go into Manhattan. But with places like the Brooklyn Botanic Garden and interesting ethnic restaurants Brooklyn is a destination worth visting all in itself. The overall experience was for us much, much nicer than staying in a hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B
Home away from home
reviews.text: The title sums it up. My wife and I have made several trips into NYC, but the Loralei has made this the most relaxing. We come from a small town in Texas, so this really says a lot when you call somewhere else "home". We would give this place six stars if there were such a rating! PLUS we had the added bonus of at least one "Lance sighting" and a couple of "Frankie sightings". I know you may have no idea what that means, but visit for yourself to find out. We will most assuredly be back!

Staying at the Lorelei was without doubt the most influential factor in enjoying our trip to New York. Prices compared to the mid-range (zillion rooms and bad tripadvisor.com reviews) hotels in central Manhatten, but we stayed in the suite, and had a very spacious, comfortable bedroom (with truly excellent matresses - and I have a bad back so I notice these things), a separate sitting room (fab in the evening for chilling with a bottle of wine), and well-set-up bathroom. It was spotless, comfy without being at all scary and fluffy and our host - you cannot get better. Robert was informative, chatty, and went out of his way to fulfil our slightly bizzare requests for NY info. Plus, he noticed we were pigging all the fruit every morning, and provided heaps more. (I cannot overenthuse about the breakfasts - best meals we had in NY without exception. And we ate well. Plus a bagel slicer to play with).
reviews.title: Fantabulous place to stay
Best of both worlds
reviews.text: The Lorelei is well situtated, 5mns from the subway and with at least a couple of good restaurants within easy walking distance. Up a couple of blocks is a bar (the Cornerstone) the plays live jazz and you can easily get a subway to Brooklyn Heights (which is worth visiting for the views of Manhatten skyline - far more breathtaking and infinitely better value than the Empire State Building). 7th Av (Brooklyn) and around had restaurants and bars to rival anything in Manhatten, yet the dizzy heights of all those skyscrapers are less than 30mns away on the (dirt cheap by London standards) subway.

reviews.title: Stellar Accoms
reviews.text: The Loralei is a perfect choice for single/couples looking for a well-run B&B convenient to downtown Manhattan and all points in Brooklyn. The rooms are spacious and equivalent to a four star hotel in amenities (luxurious cotton robes, enormous beds, beautiful furnishings, and, in the Gramercy Suite, a private bath with huge tub complete with massage jets).

description: A charming 100-year old Victorian Inn located in Brooklyn's Historic Flatbush. 30 Minutes to Manhattan.
